message: I'm getting the following when trying to install Middleman:

~$ sudo gem install middleman
Building native extensions.  This could take a while...
ERROR:  Error installing middleman:
	ERROR: Failed to build gem native extension.

        /System/Library/Frameworks/Ruby.framework/Versions/1.8/usr/bin/ruby extconf.rb
mkmf.rb can't find header files for ruby at /System/Library/Frameworks/Ruby.framework/Versions/1.8/usr/lib/ruby/ruby.h


Gem files will remain installed in /Library/Ruby/Gems/1.8/gems/eventmachine-0.12.10 for inspection.
Results logged to /Library/Ruby/Gems/1.8/gems/eventmachine-0.12.10/ext/gem_make.out
Any ideas what the problem is or how I can get around this?
I'm submitting patches to those projects (guard, for now) to try to get them to not depend on the compiled code, but for now, you'll need a compiler on the system.

Right now, some of the Middleman dependencies require compiled extensions (code written in C for performance). As a result, you need various development packages which come with Xcode. You should be able to download and install it in the Mac App Store.

The strange thing is that I actually already have the latest version of Xcode installed. 3.2.6. I also updated my Gems and although most updated OK I also got a few other messages similar to the above where it was unable to update/install. I'm not totally familiar with Ruby and Gems to know exactly how to deal with it but it looks like it's just a few individual Gems which are causing the problem...for whatever reason...
Also, is v2.0 officially out of beta tomorrow?
It looks like an uninstall/re-install of Xcode did the trick. I was then able to install middleman again and this time it all seemed to go install without any problems.

Incidentally though I just wanted to check on the version of middleman installed but running "middleman version" just results in a "command not found". How can I check to see what version I'm running?
Yup, it's out of beta now :)
Xcode often has to be reinstalled, especially after you update the OS (like to Lion). The current release is in the Xcode 4
I think it was the move to the new laptop with everything copied over that probably caused it.
